# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

You can use the built-in DateFormat function in Julia to extract the year and month from DateTime. Here is a simple solution for your problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [DateFormat("yyMM")(d) for d in df[:dt]]
end
```
This function takes as argument a DataFrame `df` and adds a new column `:ym`. For each DateTime value in the `:dt` column, it uses DateFormat to convert the DateTime to the desired format "yyMM", where yy is the last two digits of the year (00-99), MM is the month (01-12).

The function will then return `df`, which now includes a new column `:ym` containing the desired values.
